intro: Willughbeia sarawacensis, commonly known as the Sarawak willughbeia, is a tropical tree native to the rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, palm-like leaves and showy, lantern-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, lowland areas and is often found in secondary forests. Its bark and leaves have been used traditionally in local medicine, though its botanical study remains limited. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in its native habitat.
